thread.title: Rush hour at Penn Station is going to suck
thread.title_full: Rush hour at Penn Station is going to suck | New York Post

author: Danielle Furfaro
title: Rush hour at Penn Station is going to suck
text:
Penn Station will likely be a madhouse of frustrated commuters waiting on delayed and rescheduled trains Friday evening as the MTA and NJ Transit deal with hampered track access because of Friday morning’s Amtrak derailment. 
Scores of LIRR trains will be delayed or canceled for the evening commute as authorities investigate and clean up after the 9 a.m. Amtrak derailment and crash. The Acela, which was moving at slow speed, derailed and then sideswiped an incoming New Jersey Transit train, crippling service.
More than half of the nine LIRR tracks will be out of commission Friday evening, said MTA officials.
They advised riders to leave New York City early or stay late.
“To avoid delays, customers are advised to leave New York City before 4 p.m. today, or delay departure from the city until after 8 p.m.,” MTA officials said in a release.
MTA officials also suggested riders head to the Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn and leave from there instead.
Meanwhile, NJ Transit warned its riders that it will have “limited outbound service” from Penn Station. There will be hourly service into the city from Trenton and Hoboken. The agency is cross-honoring tickets on PATH and NJ Transit bus lines to help move commuters.
Officials are still investigating the cause of the derailment and crash.
